comment.body: Yup! It now runs as part of the `lint` command: https://github.com/preactjs/preact/actions/runs/6664355219/job/18111803276?pr=4173#step:5:21

pull_request.title: Improve internal JSDoc types
pull_request.body:
This PR improves the internal JSDoc types of the core source. It puts all internal types into the global namespace so you no longer need to do `import('../internal')` in the core source files as well as adds some additional JSDoc and ts-expect-error to improve typing.

I've added a "tsc" script that runs the TypeScript type checker against the core source files to validate their types. I don't know if we want to keep this as a merge check, but figured we'd give it a shot.

comment.body:
Yup, that's right. It does. I created this file to *only* include `./src/**/*` and so other src directories (like compat and hooks) and test directories are not included.

Running `tsc -p jsconfig.json` results in >5k errors. I wanted to start small and just enforce type checks on the root source folder for now.

In other words - this is the config we'll use for CI where we only enforce type correctness on the root src folder, not nested src folders, yet.

comment.body: Just curious: what's the need for this? Wouldn't the base config also include `src/**/*`, given the default value for `include` is "everything" and `src` hasn't been explicitly excluded?

issue.title: Improve internal JSDoc types
issue.body:
This PR improves the internal JSDoc types of the core source. It puts all internal types into the global namespace so you no longer need to do `import('../internal')` in the core source files as well as adds some additional JSDoc and ts-expect-error to improve typing.

I've added a "tsc" script that runs the TypeScript type checker against the core source files to validate their types. I don't know if we want to keep this as a merge check, but figured we'd give it a shot.

commits.message: Put internal types into the global namespace so we don't have to import them
Put internal types into the global namespace so we don't have to import them
Put internal types into the global namespace so we don't have to import them
improve perf by reducing prop access (#3956)
Add test for unmounting callback ref passed to useImperativeHandle (#3960)

Wait a major task after triggering GC to measure memory (#3962)

Locally, i'm getting very different memory results than what is reported in this PR so attempting this benchmarking fix to hopefully normalize and reduce noise seen in differences across different machines and environments.

Add deeper controlled input support in compat (#3926)

* Add deeper controlled input support in compat

* Add controlled inputs demo

* Replace _evented option hook with calling a callback in a microtask in the event option hook

* Use a callback instead of args array

* Remove _evented from mangle.json
Throw an error in debug if NaN is in a hook's dependency array (#3964)

Merge pull request #3968 from nnhk23/clone-element-fix

Add default props in cloneElement.

Merge pull request #3970 from kidonng/jsx-types

Add some JSX attribute types
Add missing type fields for tools

Merge pull request #3990 from preactjs/types-exports

Add missing type fields for tools

review.body:
Yooo this is fantastic!!! From quickly trying it out it looks like it resolves the issue I was running into with Fresh 👍 

Also good call on making Fragment tests out of some Suspense tests.
